# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is how you can define the function `clean_column` in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"\s|-"=>"_")
end
```

This function takes a string `col`, converts it to lower case, removes leading and trailing whitespaces, replaces any spaces or hyphens with underscores. The result is returned as the output of the function. 

You can use this function like so:

```julia
col = "My Column"
clean_column(col) # returns "my_column"
```
